<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 179, 156, 197]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 179, 579, 197]]<|/det|> Find which class interval contains the lower quartile. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 180, 920, 197]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 323, 153, 341]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 323, 658, 341]]<|/det|> On the grid, draw a histogram to illustrate the data in the table. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 324, 920, 341]]<|/det|> [4] <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 400, 880, 885]]<|/det|>

<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
The members of a swimming club are classified either as 'Advanced swimmers' or 'Beginners'. The proportion of members who are male is \(x\), and the proportion of males who are Beginners is 0.7. The proportion of females who are Advanced swimmers is 0.55. This information is shown in the tree diagram.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[278, 160, 755, 312]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 920, 370]]<|/det|>
For a randomly chosen member, the probability of being an Advanced swimmer is the same as the probability of being a Beginner.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 382, 156, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 382, 218, 400]]<|/det|>
Find \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 382, 920, 400]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 655, 149, 673]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 655, 920, 689]]<|/det|>
Given that a randomly chosen member is an Advanced swimmer, find the probability that the member is male.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 670, 920, 689]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|> Farfield Travel and Lacket Travel are two travel companies which arrange tours abroad. The numbers of holidays arranged in a certain week are recorded in the table below, together with the means and standard deviations of the prices. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[275, 131, 761, 216]]<|/det|>
Number of holidaysMean price ($)Standard deviation ($)
Farfield Travel301500230
Lacket Travel212400160
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 231, 156, 250]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 231, 504, 250]]<|/det|> Calculate the mean price of all 51 holidays. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 231, 920, 250]]<|/det|> [2] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 375, 156, 394]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 375, 920, 428]]<|/det|> The prices of individual holidays with Farfield Travel are denoted by \(\$ x_{F}\) and the prices of individual holidays with Lacket Travel are denoted by \(\$ x_{L}\) . By first finding \(\Sigma x_{F}^{2}\) and \(\Sigma x_{L}^{2}\), find the standard deviation of the prices of all 51 holidays. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 412, 920, 429]]<|/det|> [5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 154, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 735, 92]]<|/det|>

<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The diameters of apples in an orchard have a normal distribution with mean \(5.7 \text{cm}\) and standard deviation \(0.8 \text{cm}\). Apples with diameters between \(4.1 \text{cm}\) and \(5 \text{cm}\) can be used as toffee apples.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 120, 156, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 120, 813, 139]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that an apple selected at random can be used as a toffee apple.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 73, 153, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
